references.paper_title: Causal protein-signaling networks derived from multiparameter single-cell data
references.reason: This paper introduces a real-world dataset on protein signaling networks, providing valuable empirical data for evaluating causal discovery methods.

references.paper_title: Marginal structural models and causal inference in epidemiology
references.reason: This paper is foundational in establishing marginal structural models, a crucial concept in causal inference, particularly relevant to observational studies.

references.paper_title: A linear non-gaussian acyclic model for causal discovery
references.reason: This paper introduces the linear non-Gaussian acyclic model (LiNGAM), a significant advancement in causal discovery that leverages non-Gaussianity to identify causal directions.

references.paper_title: Identifiability of gaussian structural equation models with equal error variances
references.reason: This paper provides crucial identifiability results for Gaussian structural equation models under specific conditions, offering theoretical support for causal discovery methods.

references.paper_title: Causal discovery with continuous additive noise models
references.reason: This paper extends causal discovery to nonlinear relationships using additive noise models, a significant contribution for handling more realistic data scenarios.
